intro: Begonia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca begonia, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico. It features fleshy, dark green leaves with a velvety texture and striking, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
